A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie killed Star Wars as a franchise\, not necessarily because of characters that lived/or died\, but how it did it in a way that undermined the lore and the entire franchise. Nonsensical developments weren't set up (like Leia flying)\, and the diversity felt forced at the expense of the universe.

Moreover the tone was off\, and fetid attempts at humor just weren't funny. At least with the mediocre prequels I still loved the originals--this undermined the originals.

Lastly it doesn't end so much as a cliffhanger as an end to the franchise. With Rey established as the most powerful force user\, what's the point of watching? Where's the character arc?
